org.eodisp.util
Class ProgramExecution

java.lang.Object
  org.eodisp.util.ProgramExecution

public class ProgramExecution
extends java.lang.Object

Provides static methods to create new processes on any operating system, including a special method to start a new Java Virtual Machine (JVM).

The implementation uses ant classes.

Version:
$Id: ProgramExecution.java 4377 2006-11-01 22:27:09Z ibirrer $
Author:
ibirrer

Method Detail

execute

public static java.lang.Process execute(org.apache.tools.ant.types.Commandline commandline,
                                        org.apache.tools.ant.types.Environment environment,
                                        java.io.File workingDir)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
Creates a new process with the given command line. Output is sent to System.out. Usage Example: 
 Commandline commandline = new Commandline();
 commandline.setExecutable("ls");
 Process p = ProgramExecution.execute(commandline, new Environment(), new File("/tmp"));
 p.waitFor();

Parameters:
commandline - the command line. Needs to have an executable defined with Commandline.setExecutable(java.lang.String).
environment - The environment of the newly created process
workingDir - The working directory of the newly created process
Returns:
the newly created process. Call Process.waitFor() to wait for termination of the process.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an IOException occurs during process creation

executeJava

public static java.lang.Process executeJava(org.apache.tools.ant.types.CommandlineJava commandlineJava,
                                            org.apache.tools.ant.types.Environment environment,
                                            java.io.File workingDir)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
Creates a new Java Virtual Machine with the given command line options. Output is sent to System.out.

Parameters:
commandline - the command line options.
environment - The environment of the newly created JVM.
workingDir - The working directory of the newly created JVM.
Returns:
the process of the newly created JVM. Call Process.waitFor() to wait for termination of the process.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an IOException occurs during process creation
